AVSEC Order  No. 3 /2011 
Subject:- 
Procedure for protection and handling  security  information. 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act,1934, delegated 
to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 dated 
July 3, 1997, and  in continuation  of  BCAS  Circular  No. 40/2005  dated 14.9.2005,  
Commissioner of Security(Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil Aviation for the purpose of 
securing the aircraft   operations  directs that : 
(i) 
In  order to ensure protection  and handling  of   security information 
shared by  other Contracting States or  affecting their interests,  no official, 
unless authorized by general or  specific orders in writing  by the Commissioner,    
will  communicate to  another  official or  non-official  any information  or 
document  that has come  into  his possession in the course  of  his official 
duties. (Reference paragraph-87, Chapter 11 of  the  Manual of  Office 
Procedures).  
 
(ii) 
Dy Commissioner of Security (CA), Policy Division, BCAS HQrs.   shall be 
responsible for evaluating requests for the disclosure of security information  
received  from  any  aviation organisation or  entity or  a  foreign country. After  
evaluating  such request, the relevant  information  or  part of  such  information  
may be  communicated only  after  prior  approval  of  the  Commissioner  in 
accordance  with the   procedure  prescribed  to  communicate such information 
keeping  in view  the classification of  the   information.  Proper  record  of the 
evaluation  process   and  information communicated  to the concerned  entity  
shall be  maintained for the prescribed  duration  by   the designated  officer. 
(iii) 
All classified and sensitive documents/ information will be handled  by the 
designated  officers of   concerned  Divisions/ Section at  the BCAS  HQrs. and 
its  Regional Offices. As  a minimum, access to all  such documents/ information, 
shall be restricted to those with a legitimate need in the performance of their 
duties or on need-to-know-principle.  All  such documents/ information  shall be 
stored  under lock and  key when  not in use, with a  system  for  controlling  
keys.

(v) 
All  entities concerned  with  civil  aviation operations  shall  also adhere to  
similar   procedure  to handle  and  protect classified  and  sensitive documents/ 
information.
